intro: Ptychotis trachysperma, commonly known as the rough-seeded ptychotis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are small and white, and it produces small, rough-seeded fruits that are dispersed by wind. Ptychotis trachysperma is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral.
